thread.title: Broker Duncan Priest denies knowing of Ross troubles when he tried to get shares
thread.title_full: Broker Duncan Priest denies knowing of Ross troubles when he tried to get shares

author: From stuff.co.nz
title: Broker Duncan Priest denies knowing of Ross troubles when he tried to get shares
text: From stuff.co.nz A former stockbroker attempted to transfer a major chunk of shares out of Ross Asset Management less than a month before it collapsed, but denies he had any knowledge of problems at the company. Duncan Priest is in the Wellington High Court fighting to get control of $1.8 million of shares which were held by Wellington-based Ross, which collapsed in 2012. The company turned out to be a ponzi scheme, believed to be New Zealand's largest ever, with investor withdrawals only covered by deposits from new investors until the money ran out. Founder David Ross was jailed for 10 years and 10 months after pleading guilty to the ... (
